member.name: T:Goedel.Mesh.Portal.MeshPortal
member.summary: Abstract interface to a service that supports the MeshPortal API calls. Mostly for useful in test code where the ability to switch between a direct and indirect portal connection is desirable.

member.name: M:Goedel.Mesh.Portal.MeshPortal.GetService(System.String)
member.summary: Return a MeshService object for the named portal service.
member.param: Portal account address or domain name
member.returns: Mesh service object for API access to the service.

member.name: M:Goedel.Mesh.Portal.MeshPortal.GetService(System.String,System.String)
member.summary: Return a MeshService object for the named portal service.
member.returns: Mesh service object for API access to the service.

member.name: P:Goedel.Mesh.Portal.MeshPortal.Default
member.summary: Specify the default portal. If not overriden, the default default is to make a remote connection.

member.name: F:Goedel.Mesh.Portal.MeshPortal.MeshServiceClient
member.summary: May be set to the default MeshService by a calling application.

member.name: T:Goedel.Mesh.Portal.MeshPortalRemote
member.summary: Connection to network service using HTTP client.

member.name: M:Goedel.Mesh.Portal.MeshPortalRemote.#ctor
member.summary: Default constructor.

member.name: M:Goedel.Mesh.Portal.MeshPortalRemote.GetService(System.String,System.String)
member.summary: Return a MeshService object for the named portal service.
member.param: The DNS name of the service to get the service from.

member.name: T:Goedel.Mesh.Portal.SearchConstraints
member.summary: Specifies constraints to be applied to a search result. These allow a client to limit the number of records returned, the quantity of data returned, the earliest and latest data returned, etc.

member.name: P:Goedel.Mesh.Portal.SearchConstraints.NotBefore
member.summary: Only data published on or after the specified time instant is requested.

member.name: P:Goedel.Mesh.Portal.SearchConstraints.Before
member.summary: Only data published before the specified time instant is requested. This excludes data published at the specified time instant.

member.name: P:Goedel.Mesh.Portal.SearchConstraints.MaxEntries
member.summary: Maximum number of data entries to return.

member.name: P:Goedel.Mesh.Portal.SearchConstraints.MaxBytes
member.summary: Maximum number of data bytes to return.

member.name: P:Goedel.Mesh.Portal.SearchConstraints.PageKey
member.summary: Specifies a page key returned in a previous search operation in which the number of responses exceeded the specified bounds. When a page key is specified, all the other search parameters except for MaxEntries and MaxBytes are ignored and the service returns the next set of data responding to the earlier query.

member.name: P:Goedel.Mesh.Portal.SearchConstraints._Tag
member.summary: Tag identifying this class

member.name: M:Goedel.Mesh.Portal.SearchConstraints._Factory
member.summary: Factory method

member.summary: Serialize this object to the specified output stream.
member.param: If true, output is wrapped with object start and end sequences '{ ... }'.
If true, item is the first entry in a list.

member.name: T:Goedel.Mesh.Portal.ValidateRequest
member.summary: Describes the proposed account properties. Currently, these are limited to the account name but could be extended in future versions of the protocol.

member.name: P:Goedel.Mesh.Portal.ValidateRequest.Account
member.summary: Account name requested

member.name: P:Goedel.Mesh.Portal.ValidateRequest.Reserve
member.summary: If true, request a reservation for the specified account name. Note that the service is not obliged to honor reservation requests.

member.name: P:Goedel.Mesh.Portal.ValidateRequest.Language
member.summary: List of ISO language codes in order of preference. For creating explanatory text.

member.summary: Tag identifying this class

member.name: T:Goedel.Mesh.Portal.ValidateResponse
member.summary: States whether the proposed account properties are acceptable and (optional) returns an indication of what properties are valid. Note that receiving a 'Valid' responseto a Validate Request does not guarantee creation of the account. In addition to the possibility that the account namecould be requested by another user between the Validate and Create transactions, a portal service MAY perform more stringent validation criteria when an account is actually being created. For example, checking with the authoritative list of current accounts rather than a cached copy.

member.name: P:Goedel.Mesh.Portal.ValidateResponse.Valid
member.summary: If true, the specified account identifier is acceptable. If false, the account identifier is rejected.

member.name: P:Goedel.Mesh.Portal.ValidateResponse.Minimum
member.summary: Specifies the minimum length of an account name.

member.name: P:Goedel.Mesh.Portal.ValidateResponse.Maximum
member.summary: Specifies the maximum length of an account name.

member.name: P:Goedel.Mesh.Portal.ValidateResponse.InvalidCharacters
member.summary: A list of characters that the service does not accept in account names. The list of characters MAY not be exhaustive but SHOULD include any illegal characters in the proposed account name.

member.name: P:Goedel.Mesh.Portal.ValidateResponse.Reason
member.summary: Text explaining the reason an account name was rejected.

member.name: P:Goedel.Mesh.Portal.ValidateResponse._Tag
member.summary: Tag identifying this class

member.name: M:Goedel.Mesh.Portal.ValidateResponse._Factory
member.summary: Factory method

member.summary: Serialize this object to the specified output stream.

If true, item is the first entry in a list.

member.summary: If true return multiple responses if available

member.name: P:Goedel.Mesh.Portal.GetRequest.Full
member.summary: If true, the client requests that the full Mesh data record be returned containing both the Mesh entry itself and the Mesh metadata that allows the date and time of the publication of the Mesh entry to be verified.
